Summary: Decide compositional settlement claim: wire or remove
Description: Hard cutoff: if cascade settlement cannot be wired into a real API path and proven with an integration test by Monday evening 2026-02-16, remove/soften the claim from HN post copy + README/Quickstart.
Acceptance Criteria: By 2026-02-16 evening, exactly one of the following is true: (1) `cascadeSettlementCheck` is invoked by at least one end-to-end settlement/release API path and an integration test fails if it is not invoked, OR (2) all public-facing copy removes any claim that depends on a non-invoked cascade check.

Summary: Wire cascadeSettlementCheck into a real API path with stable failure code
Description: Option A (preferred): identify the first real settlement/release route users hit; insert `cascadeSettlementCheck` as pre-settlement validation and block or warn deterministically; surface a stable error/warning code when the cascade check fails.
Acceptance Criteria: There exists at least one end-to-end API route where calling settlement/release invokes `cascadeSettlementCheck`; an integration test fails if `cascadeSettlementCheck` is not invoked; a failing cascade check returns a deterministic response containing a stable, documented code; HN post copy references the feature consistent with the implementation (no implied behavior that does not exist).

Summary: Harden x402 gateway quickstart for Linux Docker networking
Description: Fix the `host.docker.internal` footgun on Linux. Prefer using Docker networking/service names where possible; otherwise document a Linux-specific `--add-host=host.docker.internal:host-gateway` / `--network host` path and how to override host connectivity via env vars.
Acceptance Criteria: `docs/QUICKSTART_X402_GATEWAY.md` contains (1) a single golden path with no inferred steps, (2) an objective copy-paste success check, (3) an explicit Linux path that does not rely on `host.docker.internal` luck, and (4) the quickstart can be run twice in a row without manual cleanup (or it prints a single explicit cleanup action).

Summary: Rewrite README into a single primary quickstart funnel
Description: Make the top of `README.md` match HN-quality: problem -> what you get -> one runnable command -> expected receipt/success check -> one next-step link.
Acceptance Criteria: README top section has exactly one primary call-to-action path; the first screen contains a runnable command and an objective success check; all links in the first screen resolve to current docs and do not 404.

Summary: Add quickstart feedback funnel and debug bundle
Description: Make silence unambiguous by providing one canonical inbound and a fast way to submit a useful report. Add a Quickstart feedback issue template and a script to collect logs/versions into a single artifact.
Acceptance Criteria: There is exactly one obvious "I tried and failed" link in the README and quickstart; a developer can file a useful quickstart report in <3 minutes using an issue template; and a `scripts/collect-debug.*` tool produces a single bundle containing docker/compose versions and relevant logs.

Summary: Draft HN repost copy and lock publish time
Description: Prepare the repost (title/body/links) and lock the publish window (target Tuesday 2026-02-17 8-9am ET). Ensure copy contains no claim that depends on unshipped or uninvoked code.
Acceptance Criteria: A draft HN repost exists in-repo with final links; the intended publish time is written as an absolute timestamp with timezone; and the copy has passed a claim-integrity review against current code paths.

Summary: Verify x402 gateway Docker image works from scratch
Description: Confirm `ghcr.io/aidenlippert/settld/x402-gateway:latest` pulls and runs cleanly on a fresh machine and produces a receipt trail on first try.
Acceptance Criteria: A documented command sequence exists where `docker pull` succeeds and the documented `docker run` flow completes a successful verify+release outcome without manual debugging.

Summary: Implement install doctor command
Description: Add `settld doctor` (or `gateway doctor`) that prints docker/compose versions, ports in use, inter-service connectivity checks, and a single pass/fail with one next action.
Acceptance Criteria: A `doctor` command exists, runs locally, and outputs copy-pasteable diagnostics including: docker version, compose version, required ports availability, and pass/fail checks with explicit remediation steps.

Summary: Harden top 5 install failures with explicit remediation
Description: From Sprint A triage, identify the 5 most common install/quickstart failures and make each self-diagnosing via error messages and/or docs one-liners.
Acceptance Criteria: The top 5 install failures from Sprint A have explicit remediation documented, and error messages include what happened, why, and the single next action.

Summary: Ship one no-edit reference integration
Description: Pick exactly one integration that matches the HN audience (tool provider selling an API). It must run end-to-end and produce a receipt without editing code.
Acceptance Criteria: A reference integration exists where a user can run it end-to-end without editing code and it produces a receipt demonstrating: work -> proof bundle -> verify -> receipt.

Summary: Track daily activation metrics
Description: Track only three numbers daily: install attempts, first receipt count, first settlement (or first paid event) count.
Acceptance Criteria: Each morning you can answer: how many tried, how many succeeded (first receipt), and where they dropped off, using a single daily log artifact.

Summary: Maintain 7-day support SLA
Description: Operational commitment: every inbound gets a first response within 12 hours for the first 7 days post-HN; every install-failed report gets a fix or workaround within 48 hours.
Acceptance Criteria: For the 7 days following 2026-02-17, a dated log shows (1) first response time <= 12 hours for all inbounds and (2) install-failed reports receive a fix or documented workaround within 48 hours.

Summary: Select and ship the single biggest real blocker
Description: Selection rule: choose the most common request that blocks real usage; it must reduce integration time or increase trust in receipts; it must be shippable end-to-end in <=10 days.
Acceptance Criteria: One blocker is explicitly selected from post-HN triage, shipped end-to-end, and the change reduces measured time-to-first-receipt (even on a small sample). Docs and demo are updated to reflect the new path.

Summary: Clarify pricing and packaging in 30 seconds
Description: Do not rebuild pricing. Make it legible: what triggers billing and what the first paid tier buys.
Acceptance Criteria: A new developer can understand what triggers billing in <=30 seconds of reading, and the first paid tier maps to a clear value boundary (volume/compliance/audit export/dispute tooling).

Summary: Harden reliability based on observed load and failure modes
Description: Prioritize data safety and operability: address any data-loss classes from triage, add backpressure/rate limits where needed, and prove basic runbooks with a kill-and-recover exercise.
Acceptance Criteria: No known data-loss class from triage remains unaddressed; backpressure/rate limiting exists where required; and a documented kill-and-recover drill has been run successfully with notes and runbook updates.

Summary: Document and test key rotation procedure
Description: Minimum viable key story for local + hosted: how keys are stored, how they rotate, and how to revoke/replace safely.
Acceptance Criteria: Docs describe key storage for local and hosted deployments; a rotation procedure exists; and rotation has been executed at least once in a test environment with recorded steps.

Summary: Publish agent roster with path ownership and KPIs
Description: Create a concrete 8-agent company roster with strict repository ownership boundaries + mission + KPIs + escalation paths.
Acceptance Criteria: `planning/ownership/agent-roster.md` defines 8 agents, owned paths, KPI per agent, and escalation map.

Summary: Ship role prompt templates for all execution agents
Description: Add reusable prompt templates with objective/scope/constraints/validation/output contract per role.
Acceptance Criteria: `planning/ownership/prompts/` contains templates for all 8 execution agents.

Summary: Enforce path ownership and handoff packet format
Description: Define non-overlapping write ownership and mandatory handoff packets for cross-agent work.
Acceptance Criteria: Rosters and templates require scope/contract-changes/test-evidence/rollback/open-risks for every handoff.

Summary: Define weekly operating cadence and go-no-go checklist
Description: Install weekly planning-execution-review rhythm and explicit release gate checklist.
Acceptance Criteria: `planning/sprints/sprint-plan.md` includes Sprint E goals, metrics, and exit criteria.

Summary: Add scoreboard metrics for agent-company execution
Description: Track core metrics to evaluate whether the agent organization improves product outcomes.
Acceptance Criteria: Scoreboard includes time-to-first-paid-call + certified tools/week + reserve fail rate + settlement success rate.

Summary: Run manager-plus-workers parallel execution smoke
Description: Execute one orchestrated run where a manager delegates to two workers in parallel and captures handoffs.
Acceptance Criteria: One recorded run proves parallel assignment, independent outputs, and successful closure of both worker tasks.

Summary: Map existing subagents to new roster
Description: Align existing planning subagent definitions with the new 8-agent execution roster and update references.
Acceptance Criteria: `planning/ownership/role-roster.md` references new roster and prompt template locations.

Summary: Publish contributor guide for agent execution model
Description: Document how humans and agents collaborate in this model including boundaries/handoffs/acceptance expectations.
Acceptance Criteria: Contributor docs describe how to request work from each role and what constitutes a complete handoff.
